questions.text: Which of the following is a disorder of POSESSION of thought?
questions.solution: option A and B are disorders of content of thought and option C is disorder of perception.

questions.text: As per Multiaxial classification of DSM -IV, Axis III includes:
questions.solution: Medical condition … option A is Axis I; option B is Axis II; Option D is Axis IV. Multi axial classification is abolished in DSM 5.

questions.text: NOT a likely side effect of Mirtazapine among the following:
questions.solution: Weight gain is associated with Mirtazapine.

questions.text: A patient presented to ophthalmologist with visual complaints. Examination revealed pigmented retinopathy. The patient is on antipsychotic for Schizophrenia, which could produce this side effect:
questions.solution: Thioridazine can cause irreversible pigmented retinopathy

questions.text: Subjective and Objective restlessness, developed as an adverse effect of Antipsychotic:
questions.solution: Most common adverse effect. They present as subjective sense of restlessness and inability to remain still, which is also objectively evident.

questions.text: Feeling of cold in one's spine on hearing a fingernail scratch a blackboard is an example of:
questions.solution: Synesthesia is the experience of a stimulus in one sense modality producing a sensoryexperience in another. Pareidolia is an interesting type of illusion, in which vivid illusions occur without the patient making any effort. These illusions are the result of excessive fantasy thinking and a vivid visual imagery.

questions.text: In which of the following psychiatric disorders listed below, will you LEAST expect self-neglect?
questions.solution: Among the following, anxiety spectrum disorders have least likelihood of self-neglect. Psychosis like Schizophrenia, severe depression, severe alcoholism can all have self-neglect.

questions.text: ECG monitoring of patients on Antipsychotics are often advised by Psychiatrist at periodic interval. Which of the following aspect is considered?
questions.solution: Prolonged QT interval and risk of Torsade de pointes with Antipsychotics is the major reason behind ECG monitoring in patients on Antipsychotics.

questions.text: New Protein Kinase C inhibitor for management of Acute and mixed mania is:
questions.solution: exerts its effects on the overactive PKC intracellular signaling.

questions.text: Known person is replaced by an imposter is the psychopathology in:
questions.solution: Option B is reverse Capgras phenomenon in which delusional belief that different people are in fact a single person who changes appearance or is in disguise.

questions.text: TILAK EFFECT, christened by Professor Venkoba Rao and Parvathy Devi is related to stimulatory effect of Lithium on _________________
questions.solution:
Just remember as one word fact. Don't worry about details…. If interested just read the points mentioned by the authors in their article

“The authors noted that the lithiummediated pineal stimulation resulted in an increased serotonergic fluorescence within the pineal of normal and adrenalectomized rats on lithium administration, indicative of pineal responding to altered electrolyte balance. The pineal of lithium-treated rats alto manifested increased serotonin content, the presence of serotonin being indicated by the development of yellowish green 5-HT fluorophores. The authors also observed that the pineal hypo-activity induced by constant light was prevented when lithium was simultaneously administered, and pineal hyperactivity was noted. This observation serves as evidence of the pineal stimulatory response to lithium.”

questions.text: Feeling familiar in unfamiliar situation is:
questions.solution: Option B is auditory equivalent of de ja vu and option A is feeling unfamiliar in familiar situations

questions.text: Which of the following Mood stabilizer may worsen psoriatic lesions?
questions.solution: Lithium may worsen psoriatic lesions

questions.text: Paralytic ileus is most likely to be associated with which one of the following antipsychotics?
questions.solution: Paralytic ileus and intestinal hypomotility are related to clozapine. During each visit constipation and bowel frequency related queries should be considered in patients on Clozapine

questions.text: Sublingual route of administration in view of high first pass metabolism is preferred in:
questions.solution: Asenapine has high first pass metabolism

questions.text: Abrupt onset of symptoms, impending doom of death, autonomic arousal is all seen in:
questions.solution: panic disorder has several episodes of panic attacks - which are usually abrupt onset, episodes, with several autonomic and somatic symptoms

questions.text: A 45-year-old man with schizoaffective disorder is on lithium, sertraline, lorazepam, and olanzapine. He develops low sodium levels and complains of extreme lethargy. The most likely offending agent is
questions.solution: antidepressants of class SSRI has likely risk of hyponatremia with elderly and should be watch for. Antipsychotics also have a risk but most likely reported with SSRIs.

questions.text: Lithium induced tremors can be managed with:
questions.solution: Propranolol is effective in management of Lithium and Valproate induced tremors.

questions.text: Flumazenil can reverse the effects of an overdose of which of the following drugs?
questions.solution: Flumazenil is Benzodiazepine antagonist.

questions.text: PRIAPISM is a rare, reported side effect of which of the following Antidepressant?
NOT considered as a Catatonic feature among the following is:
questions.solution: Cataplexy is a feature of Narcolepsy

questions.text: Which of the following mood stabilizer has auto induction property?
questions.solution: Carbamazepine is an enzyme inducer and has auto induction property

questions.text: Partial agonism at Dopamine receptors is present in the Antipsychotic:
questions.solution: Aripiprazole has partial agonism at Dopamine receptors.

questions.text: Emotional quality attached to speech with its variations in melody, intonations, stresses and accents is called:
NOT a feature of Neuroleptic Malignant Syndrome is:
questions.solution: There is Leukocytosis in Neuroleptic Malignant Syndrome

questions.text: Suvorexant and Lumborexant exert their effects on______receptors.
questions.solution: They are Orexin receptor Antagonists which are now prescribed for management of Insomnia

questions.text: Sudden rapid shift of emotions from one pole to another without any external cue is called as ____________ of Affect
Which among the following is NOT prescribed as approved or off- label, for sleep in individuals with Insomnia?
questions.solution: Bupropion can cause sleep disturbance. Option A is FDA approved for sleep. Option C is an antidepressant and Option D is an antipsychotic, both of them at low dose given for sleep disturbance.

questions.text: Which of the following Antidepressant has Melatonin agonist effects?
questions.solution: Agomelatine has agonism at Melatonin receptors. It also has 5HT2D serotonin receptor antagonism

questions.text: Which of the following Antipsychotic belongs to class butyrophenone?
questions.solution: Risperidone is a benzisoxazole; quetiapine is a dibenzothiazepine, chlorpromazine is a phenothiazine; and haloperidol is a butyrophenone.

questions.text: Which of the following Antidepressants among the following is least likely to have discontinuation syndrome?
questions.solution: Fluoxetine has a long half-life of 72 hours and its metabolite has half-life of more than 2 weeks. Hence it is least likely to have discontinuation syndrome with abrupt stopping of Antidepressants.

questions.text: Fluctuating cognition, early onset parkinsonian symptoms, REM sleep disorder are all related to:
questions.solution: Lewy body dementia presents with following features. Most common dementia is Option A

questions.text: NOT a component of CIWA -Ar score for assessment of Alcohol withdrawal:
questions.solution: Clinical Institute of Withdrawal of Alcohol- revised scale components are Tremor, Anxiety, Nausea and vomiting, Orientation, Paroxysmal sweating, Headache, Agitation, Visual disturbances, Tactile disturbances, Auditory disturbances.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT an Extrapyramidal Symptom pointer in a patient on Antipsychotics?
questions.solution: Constipation is not an extrapyramidal symptom

choices.text: Regular intake of coffee during evenings

questions.text: which of the following is NOT recommended as a part of Sleep Hygiene measures for patients with Insomnia?
questions.solution: Use of stimulants including caffeine in evenings and close to bedtimes can affect your sleep

questions.text: NOT a Slow wave sleep phenomenon among the following:
questions.solution: Nightmare is REM sleep phenomenon. Option A, C and D are same and NREM (Slow wave sleep) phenomenon.

questions.text: FDA approved drug for Female Hypoactive Sexual Desire Disorder is:
questions.solution: Flibanserin is a NE-Dopamine Disinhibitor. Option A is for sleep onset insomnia (Melatonin agonist) and option B is 5HT2A inverse agonist antipsychotic for psychotic symptoms in Parkinson patients

questions.text: Among Paraphilic disorders, sexual focus on objects that are intimately associated with human body or on non-genital body parts is a feature of:
questions.solution:
Option A- recurrent urge for genital exposure to stranger while

option C - achieving orgasm by rubbing of penis against fully clothed female body parts.

Option D - sexual gratification by being humiliated, beaten or bound to suffer

questions.text: Which of the following defense mechanism is known as 'Sour grape defense'?
questions.solution: Finding a reason or justification so as to avoid the distress or disappointment happens in this defense mechanism. Remember the old story of the fox and sour grapes?

questions.text: Drug of choice for Treatment Resistant Schizophrenia is?
questions.solution: Clozapine is the drug of choice for TRS.

questions.text: Varenicline, used in Nicotine addiction works as:
questions.solution: They act as partial agonist on Nicotinic Ach receptors.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the triad characteristic of normal pressure hydrocephalus?
questions.solution: Normal pressure hydrocephalus or NPH is a syndrome of cerebral ventricular dilatation with normal CSF pressure. The changes are prominent in the third ventricle, affecting the pyramidal tract representing legs. This leads to a triad of dementia, gait ataxia, and urinary incontinence. The dementia is reversible if NPH is treated promptly with shunt or repeated lumbar puncture.

questions.text: A 16-year-old boy presents with cycles of sleepiness lasting for weeks associated with excessive weight gain and hunger. Which of the following isan appropriate diagnosis?
questions.solution: Klein Levin Syndrome is characterized by recurrent episodes of prolonged sleep intermingled with periods of normal sleep. During the prolonged sleep phases, social withdrawal, apathy, irritability, and increased eating can occur. Unexplained fever may occur in such patients. This is a rare illness with onset between the ages of 10 and 21 years. It is mostly self-limiting

questions.text: Which of the following is not a mature defense mechanism?
questions.solution: Denial is an immature defense mechanism. Mature defense mechanism as Humor, Altruism, Anticipation, Asceticism, Suppression, Sublimation

questions.text: NALTREXONE, as a de addiction agent works by:
questions.solution: Mu opioid receptor antagonism and thus reduce craving

questions.text: Which is a chromosomal deletion syndrome closely related to schizophrenia phenotype?
questions.solution: Di George syndrome, also known as Velo-cardio-facial syndrome (VCFS) is a genetic, autosomal dominant condition by. spontaneous deletion of chromosome 22q11.2 is responsible in most cases. It is characterized by mental retardation, facial dysmorphic features, cardiac anomalies, and neuroendocrine abnormalities, such as absent parathyroid, maldeveloped thymus, etc. It is thought to be related to problems in neural crest cell migration. Interestingly, the discovery of COMT polymorphism to be located at the same chromosomal loci adds to the speculation that psychosis is linked to this chromosome.

questions.text: A 38-year-old man had his most recent episode of schizophrenic relapse 6 months ago. Though he responded well to antipsychotics he still hears occasional voices. Currently he has lost sleep, appetite, and weight and complains of low energy and pervasive anhedonia with low mood. This description best fits which of the following ICD-10 diagnosis?
questions.solution: Post schizophrenic depression is recognized in ICD-10 as a major depressive episode which starts within 12 months of the most recent psychotic episode; while residual psychotic symptoms can be present, they must not be prominent.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a medical cause of panic attacks?
questions.solution: Hypothyroidism do not cause Panic symptoms. Hyperthyroidism may cause panic symptoms.

questions.text: Which of the following is the single most important factor predicting suicide risk?
questions.solution: Past history of suicide attempt is the most important risk factor.

questions.text: Obsession with obtaining sexual gratification from cadavers is known as:
questions.solution:
Option A - prepubescent child,

option B - use of enema and

option D - Sexual arousal by physical or psychological suffering of another person
